James by the grace of God kinge of England Scotland ffraunce and Ireland defender of the faith etc. To the Reverend ffather in God John Bushopp
of Bristoll. And to our trustie and Welbeloved Sir George Snigge Knight one of the Barons of our Exchequer, Sir Edward Gorges, Sir Thomas Seymor Knight,
lawrence hyde Recorder of the Cittie of Bris[toll] Simon Robson Doctor of Dyvinitye Deane of Bristoll, ffrauncis James Doctor of Lawe Chaucellor of the Diocesse
of Bristoll, Richard Codrington Esquire, Cr[...] Greene, Roberte Gulliford Batchelors of Divinytie, John Adams, Thomas Hughes, Thomas Younge, John Tynte
Esquiers, James Buck William Meredith, Myles Jackson gentleman, Israell Gleson Bachelor of lawe, John Yonge and Nicholas Hill gentlemen Greetinge. Knowe yee
that we for the due execucion of a certaine Statute made in the Highe Courte of Parliament houl[den] the Seaven and twentyeth daye of October in the three and fortyth yere
of the Raigne of our late Sister Queene Elizabeth decease[d] intituled An Acte to redresse the mysimployment of land goodes and stockes of money herefore gyven to
charitable uses. And haveinge Specyall truste and conf[iden]ce in your approved fidelityes Wysedomes and discrecions Have aucthorised you to be our Commissioners
And by these present doe gyve unto you and to any fouer or more of you full power and aucthoritye to enquire aswell by the oathes of twelve lawfull men or
more of the Cittye of Bristoll and Countye of the same as by all other goode and lawfull wayes and meanes accordinge to the purporce and true meanynge of
the saide Statute, What landes tenementes rentes annuyties profittes Hereditamentes goodes chattles money or stockes of money, Have at any tyme or tymes heretofore bin gyven
lymitted appoynted or assigned by us or any of our progenitors, or by any other Well disposed person or persons, bodies pollitique or corporate, for the releife of aged ympotent and
poore people mayntenaunce of sicke and maymed souldiours or marryners, School[es] of learnynge, ffree Schooles or Schollers in universityes, repayre of Bridges, portes, Havens
Cawsewayes, Churches, Seabankes or Highewayes, educacion or preferment of Orphances, reliefe stocke or mayntenance for Howses of correction, marriadges of poore maydes, supportacion ayde
or helpe of younge tradesmen, handicraftesmen, or persons decayed, Releife or redempcion or prisoners or Captives, or ayde or ease of any poore Inhabitantes concerninge payement of ffifteenes
settinge out of Souldiours, or other taxes in any parryshe town or place Within our saide Cittye of Bristoll and Countye of the same. And of all and singuler the abuses misdemeanors
breaches of trust negligences mysimployment not ymployinge conceallinge defraudinge misconvertinge or misgoverment of the same landes tenementes rentes annuyties profittes Hereditaments
goodes chattles money or Stockes of money or any of them heretofore given limitted appoynted or assigned to or for any the charitable and godlie uses before rehearsed
accordinge to the purporce and true meanynge of the saide Statute. And uppon suche Inquyrie heareinge and examyninge thereof accordinge to the saide
Statute to sett downe such orders Iudgment and decrees as the saide landes tenementes rentes annuyties profittes hereditamentes goodes chattles money and stockes of mo[ney] may be
dulie and faithfullye imployed to and for such of the charitable uses and intentes before rehearsed respectyvely for Which they Were given lymitted assigned or appoy[nted] by
the Donors and ffounders thereof accordinge to the purporce and true meanynge of the saide Statute And therefore We commaunde you that at certaine [?days]
and places Which you or any foure or more of you shall appoynte in this behalfe, ye or any foure or more of you doe make dilligent Inquirye and inquiryes uppon t[he]
premisses, and all and singuler the same and all other thinges appoynted by the saide Statute for you or any foure or more of you to doe and execute, that ye or foure of you at the
leaste performe doe and execute With effecte in all poyntes and in everye respecte accordinge to the saide statute and the true entent and meanynge thereof. And the same
Inquisicion and Inquisicions and every of them together With all Decrees Iudgementes orders and proceedinges Which you or any foure or more of you shall accordinge to the
saide Statute thereuppon make or sett downe. That you or foure or more of you have before us in our Chauncerye With all convenyent speed. Or at the farthest in
Quindena Pasche Within 15 days Easter. nexte commynge under the handes and sealles of you or any foure or more of you and the handes and sealles of them by Whome the same Inquisicion and
Inquisicions shalbe made together With this our Commission; And we also commaunde by aucthoritye hereof our Sheriffes of our saide Cittye of Bristoll that at suche
tymes dayes and places as you or any foure or more of you shall appoynte them, they shall cause to come before you or anye foure or more of you such and as many
honest and lawfull men of the saide Cittye and Countye of the same, aswell Within liberties as Without by Whome the truthe in the premisses may be before be known to
inquyre of the premisses uppon their oathes as you or anye foure or more of you shall require and commaunde them; Wyllinge alsoe and chardginge and
commaundinge all and singuler our Justices of peace Mayors Sheriffes Bayliffes Constables headboroughes and all other our Officers Ministers and Subiectes
to Whome in this case it shall or may appertaine, to be aydinge helpinge and assistinge to your our saide Commissioners or to any foure or more of you
in the due execucion of this our Commission. As they and everye of them tender our pleasure and will answere to the contarye att their uttmoste perills. In wyntes Whereof we have caused these our lettres of Commission to be sealled With our greate sealle Wyntes our selfe at Westminster the eighteenth daye of
Julye in the Sixte yeare of our Raigne of England ffraunce and Ireland and Scotland the xlith per Dominum Cancellarium Anglie virtute Statuta; By the Lord Chancellor of England by force of statute. Coppin.

By vertue of this comission wee whose names are subs[cribed] being foure of the
Comissioners within written have called the parties interessed in the landes tenementes
profittes and heredetamentes in the Inquisicion and sch[edule] her[unto] annexed specified
whoe appeared severall tymes [wi]thout making [...] [...] And the residue of
the execucion of this comission appeareth the [...] [...] And in an order
and decree thereupon make with Inquisicion and order are hereu[nto] affixed. In
[...] whereof wee have setto our handed the sixtenth of Aprill 1609 Annoque
regni domini [...] Jacobi Anglie ffrancie et hibernie Septimo at Bristol xlij?? /
